titles.title: Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles (fols. 2ra-118vb) I-1) The Letter of Dionysius on the Martyrdom of Sts. Peter and Paul, with colophon (fols. 2ra-10rb) I-2) Introduction (fols. 10ra-10vb) I-3) The Preaching of St. Peter, with colophon (fols. 10vb-19vb) I-4) The Martyrdom of St. Peter (fols. 20ra-23va) I-5) The Martyrdom of St. Paul, with colophon (fols. 23va-25ra) I-6) The Preaching of St. Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 25rb-26va) I-7) The Martyrdom of St. Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 26va-28vb) I-8) The Acts of St. John the son of Zebedee (fols. 28(a)ra-34vb) I-9) The Martyrdom of St. Bartholomew (fols. 35ra-36vb) I-10) The Martyrdom of St. Andrew (fols. 37ra-37vb), acephalous I-11) The Preaching of St. Matthew (fols. 38ra-39va) I-12) The Martyrdom of St. Luke (fols. 39va-40vb) I-13) The Acts of St. Matthew, with colophon (fols. 41ra-45rb) I-14) The Preaching of St. James the Just (fols. 45va-46va) I-15) The Martyrdom of St. James the Just (fols. 46va-48va) I-16) The Preaching of St. Bartholomew (fols. 48vb-50vb) I-17) The Martyrdom of St. Philip (fols. 50vb-52va) I-18) The Preaching of St. Andrew (fols. 52va-58va) I-19) The Acts of St. Andrew and St. Bartholomew (fols. 58va-59vb) I-20) The Preaching of St. Philip (fols. 60ra-71rb) I-21) The Martyrdom of St. Andrew (fols. 71rb-79vb) I-22) The Death of St. John the son of Zebedee (fols. 79vb-83ra) I-23) The Martyrdom of St. James the son of Alphaeus (fols. 83rb-83vb) I-24) The Preaching of St. Matthias (fols. 84ra-93rb) I-25) The Acts of St. James the son of Zebedee (fols. 93rb-95vb) I-26) The Martyrdom of St. James the son of Zebedee (fols. 96ra-97rb) I-27) The Martyrdom of St. Mark the Evangelist (fols. 97va-100va) I-28) The Preaching of St. Thomas (fols. 100va-110vb) I-29) The Martyrdom of St. Thomas (fols. 111ra-114va) I-30) The Preaching of St. Judas Thaddeus, with colophon (fols. 114va-118vb)
Additiones 1-2.

txstates.txstate: The binding is disintegrated; the front cover is missing. Some leaves are missing (at least between fols. 36v and 37r).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is missing; the back board is broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations (only a few remains of the threads are visible).

txfolios.txfolio: 118 + 1 originating from a different Ms. (16th century?). Number 28 is repeated twice by mistake; fol. 91 not photographed.

squires.squire: Since the leaves are mostly separated, it is difficult to understand the structure of quires and their number. The only indications, though insufficient, are two quire marks on fol. 18r (፫ “3”) and on fol. 26r (፬ “4”). Fol. 119 is a rejected leaf originationg from a different Ms. (Gǝbrä Ḥǝmamat; 16th cent.?)

taunit.ln-info: On average, the number of the lines to a folio is 30/31.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written below the ruling (in some cases also above it). The bottom line is written above the ruling. On some leaves, writing rulings are continued beyond A vertical line, towards the ruling pricks (irregularly; s., e.g. fols. 78r, 89r). One or two ruled lines have been left empty at the bottom, on fols. 64v-69v, and at the top, on fol. 28r (space for ornamental band).

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Compressed script used on fol. 36vb. - Between Texts I-1 and I-2 the text divider is missing.

desccontent.text: I. Gädlä Ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles
desccontent.mss: EMML no. 1482 (15th cent.), fols. 2r-152v: “Combat of the Apostles [Gadla Ḥawāreyāt]” (EMML IV, 606-08; Monastery of Abba Säyfä Mikaʾel, Ṣaʿada Ǝmba Śǝllase, Kärän, Eritrea). EMML no. 1767 (1292/7), fols. 4r-232r: “Combat of the Apostles [Gadla Ḥawāreyāt]” (EMML V, 237-39; Monastery of Ḥayq Ǝsṭifanos, Ambassäl, Wällo). EMML no. 1825 (14/15th cent.), fols. 1r-152v: “Combat of the Apostles [Gadla Ḥawāreyāt]” (EMML V, 271-72; Monastery of Ḥayq Ǝsṭifanos, Ambassäl, Wällo). Éthiopien 58 (15th cent.), fols. 1r-162v: “ገድለ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ Gadla Ḥawaryat <Vies des Apôtres>” (AbbCat 69-70. See also CRAbb 69-71, nos. 45,46). Éthiopien 64 (16th cent.), fols. 1r-171v: “ገድለ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ Gadla Ḥawaryat <Vies des Apôtres>” (AbbCat 74-75). Orient. 678 (15th cent.), fols. 1r-171v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 59-62, no. 101). Ṭanasee 173 = Daga Ǝsṭifanos 62 (15th cent.), fols. 1ra-178rb “ገድለ፡ ሐዋርያት። [= Viten der Apostel]” (SixTana III, 226). ZotBNat éth. 52 (14th cent.), fols. 16r-204v: “Actes et martyres des apôtres et évangélistes” (ZotBNat 53-57, no. 33 bis). ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ EMML no. 676 (20th cent.), fols. 1r-255r: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (EMML II, 431-32; Patriarchate Library, quarter of Mäkkakäläña, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 813 (1944/5), fols. 1r-236r: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (EMML III, 128-29; Church of the Apostles, quarter of Täklä Haymanot, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 2406 (1775/1809), fols. 3r-124r: “Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles [Gadla Ḥawāreyāt]” (EMML VI, 469; Church of Afär Bayne Täklä Haymanot, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 4442 (18th cent.), fols. 3r-161r: “Combat of the Apostles [Gadla Ḥawāreyāt]” (EMML X, 156-57; Church of Sälla Dǝngay, Moǧa and Wädärra, Shoa). Orient. 683 (17th cent.), fols. 1r-254v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 62-65, no. 102). Orient. 681 (1705/6), fols. 1r-196v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 65-66, no. 103). Orient. 680 (1711/12), fols. 1r-193v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 66-67, no. 104). Orient. 682 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-195v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 67, no. 105). Orient. 677 (1764/5), fols. 1r-199v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 67-69, no. 106). Orient. 679 (1785/86), fols. 1r-183v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 69-70, no. 107). Orient. 684 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-94v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 70, no. 108). Orient. 685 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-149v: “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 70-71, no. 109). Orient. 829 (18th cent.), fol. 12r (mutilated): “The Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles” (WrBriMus 71, no. 110). StrRyMan 6 (early 19th cent. ?), fols. 1ra-242r: “Gädlä Ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles and the Evangelists” (StrRyMan 9-12). Vat.Aeth. 234 (20th cent.), fols. 5r-160v: “Acta apostolorum apocrypha” (GréTisVat I, 739-741). Vat.Aeth. 296 (1763), fols. 2r-208v: “Actes apocryphes des apôtres” (LanVat 494-95).

literature.text: A. Bausi; “Ḥawaryat: Gädlä ḥawaryat”, in: EAE II, 1049-51. ID., “I manoscritti etiopici di J.M. Wansleben nella Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenze”, RSE 33, 1989 [1991], 5-33. BauGaH. CANT, s. index. I. Guidi, “Gli Atti apocrifi degli Apostoli nei testi copti, arabi ed etiopici”, Giornale della società Asiatica Italiana 2, 1888, 1-66. F. Morard, “Acts of the Apostles”, in: CE I, 58-61.

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 2ra (Discourse of Dionysius on the Martyrdom of Sts. Peter and Paul): በስመ፡ʼʼ… ፍናዌ፡ መልእክት፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ወክቡር፡ ድዮናስዮስ፡ አርዮስ፡ ፋጎስ፡ ኀበ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጢሞቴ[ዎስ]: ፈነዎ፡ ረድኡ፡ ለጳው[ሎ]ስ፡ ኅሩይ፡ በእንተ፡ ፍጻሜ፡ ስምዖመ፡ ለጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ፍንዋን፡ ላእካን፡ ወንጹሐን፡ በሀገረ፡ ሮምያ፡ አመ፡ [n.l.]ለሐምሌ፡ በሰላመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ አሜን፨…
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 2ra (Discourse of Dionysius on the Martyrdom of Sts. Peter and Paul): In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, the epistle which saint and honored Dionysius, the Areopagite, sent to St. Timothy, the disciple of Paul the elect, concerning the conclusion of the martyrdom of Peter and Paul, sent and pure messengers in the city of Rome (Romya) on [n.l.] of Ḥamle, in the peace of God, the Father. Amen. ...
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 118vb, l.5 (The Preaching of St. Judas Thaddeus): … on the second day of the month Ḥamle, glorifying the Father, and the Son and the Holy Spirit. Forever and ever. Amen. (Colophon) Here the Vitae of 12 Apostles of 72 Disciples is completed. [They] prayed and said: “We have toiled and we were tortured for Your name; which is our reward?” And our Lord said to them: “You should pass in the openness at the last day”. And they said: “Which is the reward for the one whom is trust in our prayer and makes our commemoration and for the one who caused the book to be written?”. And He said: “He should pass with you in the openness at the last day”.  Forever and ever. Amen. Amen.
desccontent.details:
For each text, the equivalent pages of Budge's Edition (BConAp I, II) and the abbreviations used by Bausi in Annali 2000-2001 are given here following:

I-1) BConAp I, 50-66; BConAp II, 42-57; Dio in BauGaH

I-2) BConAp I, 3-6; BConAp II, 2-3; Int in BauGaH

I-3) BConAp I, 7-36; BConAp II, 5-25; Pt1 in BauGaH

I-4) BConAp I, 37-41, 45-49; BConAp II, 26-34; Pt2 in BauGaH

I-5) BConAp I, 42-45; BConAp II, 35-39; Pa1 in BauGaH

I-6) BConAp I, 67-70; BConAp II, 58-61; Si1 in BauGaH

I-7) BConAp I, 70-72; BConAp II, 62-64; Si2 in BauGaH

I-8) BConAp I, 189-213; BConAp II, 186-211; Jo1 in BauGaH

I-9) BConAp I, 93-100; BConAp II, 87-92; Ba2 in BauGaH

I-10) BConAp I, 184-88; BConAp II, 181-85; An2 in BauGa

I-11) BConAp I, 225-42; BConAp II, 223-40; Ma1 in BauGaH

I-12) BConAp I, 119-25; BConAp II, 115-21; Luc in BauGaH

I-13) (BConAp I, 101-13; BConAp II, 93-114; Mt1 in BauGaH)

I-14) BConAp I, 73-76; BConAp II, 65-68; Jc1 in BauGaH

I-15) BConAp I, 76-82; BConAp II, 69-75; Jc2 in BauGaH

I-16) BConAp I, 83-92; BConAp II, 76-86; Ba1 in BauGaH

I-17) BConAp I, 135-39; BConAp II, 131-36; Ph2 in BauGaH

I-18) BConAp I, 140-56; BConAp II, 137-53; An1 in BauGaH

I-19) BConAp I, 156-83; BConAp II, 154-85; AnB in BauGaH

I-20) BConAp I, 126-34; BConAp II, 122-30; Ph1 in BauGaH

I-21) BConAp I, 184-88; BConAp II, 181-85; An2 in BauGaH

I-22) BConAp I, 214-22; BConAp II, 212-20; Jo2 in BauGaH

I-23) BConAp I, 223-24; BConAp II, 221-22; JcA in BauGaH

I-24) BConAp I, 225-42; BConAp II, 223-40; Ma1 in BauGaH

I-25) BConAp I, 247-53; BConAp II, 246-52; JZ1 in BauGaH 

I-26) BConAp I, 254-57; BConAp II, 253-56; JZ2 in BauGaH                                                                                     

I-27) BConAp I, 257-64; BConAp II, 257-64; Mar in BauGaH

I-28) BConAp I, 265-87; BConAp II, 265-86; Th1 in BauGaH

I-29) BConAp I, 287-95; BConAp II, 287-95; Th2 in BauGaH

I-30) BConAp I, 296-306; BConAp II, 296-306; Jud in BauGaH.

- Text I-10: text missing before fol. 37ra = BConAp I, 184-187 l.17.

- According to the distribution of the texts, the Gädlä ḥawaryat of DZ-004 would belong to II recension (cp. BauGaH, 83-84). However, Text I-4, the Martyrdom of St. Peter,  contains the "Discourse of Peter on the Cross" (= BConAp I, 45-49; BConAp II, 30-34). On the Discourse, cp. BauGaH 84-86.

additional.cont: Fol. 73va: Note concerning a church feast (?)
additional.add: Fol. 37va (below the text): ዘገነተ፡ ማርያም፡ ግበሮ፡ ተስከ፡ ደቅቀ፡ በኀምሊ[sic]፡ አ፲ወ፸፨ ዘይኮን

additional.cont: Fol. 118vb: Unclear note.

extras.extra: - A few times, part of the lines (usually the last letter of a word) from the incipit of the texts are written at the margin, outside the column: e.g., fols. 39va, 48vb, 79vb, 60ra. - Corrections over erasures: fols. 24ra, 31ra, 32vb, 38rb, 104va. - Erasures: fols. 36vb, 41ra. - Cues for the rubricator (numbers) written in the margins of the column: e.g., fols. 39v, 59v. - Crude notes in pen or in pencil on fols. 7v (above the text), 8v (above the text), 9r (above the text) and on the right inner board.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Readings are indicated by the commemoration dates of the Apostles, written in the main hand, in red or in black, in the upper margin: አመ፲ለሐምሌ: ናትናኤል።: fol. 25r አመ፻ለጥር፡ ዮሐንስ።: fol. 28(a)r አመ፩ለመስከረም፡ በርተሎሜዎስ።: fol. 35r አመ፳፪ለጥቅምት፡ ሉቃስ፡: fol. 39v አመ፲፪ለጥቅምት፡ ማቴዎስ፡: fol. 41r አመ፲ወ፰ለኀምሌ: ያዕቆብ።: fol 45v አመ፬ለታኅሣሥ: አንድርያስ።: fol. 52v አመ፡ ፲፰፡ ለኅደር፡: fol. 60ra አመ፲ለያ[sic]ካቲት፡ ያዕቆብ።: fol. 83r አመ፰ለመጋቢት፡ ማቲያስ፡: fol. 84r አመ፲ወ፯᎓ ለሚያዝያ፡ ያዕቆብ።: fol. 93r አመ፴ለሚያዝያ፡ ማርቆስ።: fol. 97v አመ፳፮(?)᎓ ለግንቦት፡ ቶማስ።: fol. 100v አመ፪ለሐምሌ: ታዴዎስ።: fol. 114v

frames.frame: - Fol. 2r: coloured (red, yellow, black), horizontal and vertical ornamental band, framing all the text, above, around both lateral sides, between the two columns, below the text. Geometric motifs (interlaces). - Fol. 10r: simple, narrow, uncoloured (red), horizontal band (within the columns ab) dividing two different texts. Geometric motifs (interlaces).
